required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Morphological and Radiological Data in Patients With Urolithiasis
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of the Morphological Picture of the Renal Parenchyma With the Results of Mathematical Analysis of Intrarenal Transport of Contrast Medium in Computed Tomography in Patients With Urolithiasis

lead_sponsor.agency: I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University

clinical_study.source: I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to compare the ultrastructural changes in the renal parenchyma with the results of postprocessing CT analysis with contrast enhancement in patients with urolithiasis.

primary_outcome.measure: To evaluate the features of interrenal transport of contrast agent and the structural state of the renal tissue
primary_outcome.description: The data of 3D analysis of CT of the kidneys in patients with urolithiasis

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess the features of the morphological structure of glomeruli, tubules, perivascular and interstitial spaces of renal tissue in patients with urolithiasis
secondary_outcome.description: The assessment will be based on intraoperative biopsy

arm_group.description: Patients with confirmed urolithiasis who is assigned to PCNL.
Patients with renal tumor without urolithiasis in history who is assigned to partial or radical nephrectomy due to renal tumor.

intervention.description: PCNL will be carried out in accordance with the standards and capabilities of the medical center. After the procedure pathomorphological data of the renal parenchyma will be assessed
Partial nephrectomy will be carried out in accordance with the standards and capabilities of the medical center. After the procedure pathomorphological data of the renal parenchyma will be assessed
Nephrectomy will be carried out in accordance with the standards and capabilities of the medical center. After the procedure pathomorphological data of the renal parenchyma will be assessed

facility.name: Institute for Urology and Reproductive Health, Sechenov University.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: I.M. Sechenov First Moscow State Medical University
